attributes.action: Stop video games publishers forcing us to pay extra for games that we have already bought
attributes.additional_details:
We, the undersigned, call on the government to act in the public interest and stop video games publishers forcing us to pay extra money to play games we have already bought.

1) It is unacceptable for publishers to withhold parts of a game that is on the disk, that we must pay extra to have access to, after we have bought the game.

2) It is unacceptable for publishers to force people to pay to either play in multiplayer or single player modes if a game has been bought second hand.

The publishers already have the money when the game is bought, and we do not believe that we should be forced to pay more money to play what we legally own. It is extortion, morally wrong, and we urge the government to take action to stop video games publishers trying to take advantage of people.
